pageTitle: 3600 Series Memory Options and Configuration Guide, No. 544  [Cisco 3600 Series Multiservice Platforms] - Cisco Systems
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {40651=As of October 26th, 1998 the Cisco 3600 Series default DRAM memory size has been increased to 32 MB (MEM3600-32D-INCL) replacing the old default of 16 MB. This replaces the existing 16 MB DRAM memory option available on both the Cisco 3640 and Cisco 3620., 115696=15-1630-02, 116228=15-2096-01, 114340=15-1593-01 and 15-1873-02, 113773=15-1593-01, 40914=The 32 MB DRAM memory default is available on all new system orders placed after October 26th, 1998 on the following feature sets including: 11.1A, 11.2P, 11.3, 11.3T, 12.0, and 12.0T. There will be no additional charge for this memory increase. The Cisco 3600 Series minimum DRAM memory requirement of 24 MB for the IP and IP/IPX/AT/DEC feature sets is still valid for customers who are upgrading to 12.0(1) or 12.0(1)T, and who currently run with 16 or 20 MB of DRAM memory. There are no changes to the Cisco 3600 Series Flash memory default, currently set at 4 MB., 117109=15-2095-01 and 15-1630-02, 113508=15-1873-02, 116526=15-1630-01 and 15-1873-02, 114040=15-2095-01}
textBeforeTable: The following table list the maximum number of Network Modules that can be configured on a Cisco 3640/3620, and the minimum Cisco IOS version required. Table 2: Cisco 3600 Series Maximum Network Modules Supported No xboot functionality. Netbooting not supported in RMON mode 115.2 kbps asynchronous support for console and auxiliary ports Two PCMCIA slots for additional Flash memory capabilities Two general purpose PCI bus slots for network modules Two 80-pin SIMM slots for up to 32 MB of flash memory Non-parity DRAM SIMMS supported Four 60ns, 72-pin SIMM slots for up to 64 MB of DRAM 32-bit wide DRAM memory system 20 Mhz PCI based 2 slot bus System controller and PCI bus interface 80 Mhz R4700 RISC processor Cisco 3620 No xboot functionality.
